page.title: 04VALE OF CLWYD A SHEEP FARM.
page.content: On a 350 acre farm,one man specialises in breeding{Welsh Mules_speckle_faced {Welsh ewes x a Blue Leicester ram.Visitors from all over the world come to study his methods."It is not just work,it is a way of life"he says,Autumn is a crucial time,Breeding success depends on the good physical condition of sire and ewes.During pre_lambing ewes are checked at 1 a.m. Most ewes give birth to twins.Ewes and lambs spend 24 hrs,in small pens to develop bonding.The lambs are tailed,navels dressed with iodine and males castrated.The ewes are fed next day,whatever the weather ewes and lambs are put out to grass.
